mads:mads.mads:note: It is unknown which Albinus is the author of these poems, that are sometimes attributed to Albinus the Neoplatonic philosopher (http://id.loc.gov/authorities/names/n91064768)
Smith's Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology, Vol , 1867, p. 1:

Oxford Classical Dictionary, 3rd ed, 2005, online: "Albinus (2), writer on music, geometry, and dialectic, probably identical with Ceionius Rufius Albinus (Prosopography of the Later Roman Empire 1 ‘Albinus’ 14), the consul of ad 335, and perhaps with the poet of works entitled De metris and Res romanae; one fragment of each survives...." Edward Courtney; Robert A. Kaster.
